result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Weaver, Nicholas Michael-Ray

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Receipt of Passport surrendered to the Court.

passport notice
The original document was titled: passport form-notice
The original history event date is: 10-27-2022

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to have no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 18. Defendant is to have no use of any social media to include Instagram, Kik, or any chatting functions. Defendant prohibited from using any application where the content automatically deletes upon the recipient opening the content. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. If the defendant has a passport he is to surrender his passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 48 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

8:28 AM Defendant Nicholas Michael-Ray Weaver in court.  Attorney Jonathan A. LaVoy in court for Nicholas Michael-Ray Weaver. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
